4 of 6 people (67%) found this review helpful
Recommended
1.4 hrs on record
Played this game for the first few minutes, and you quickly get immersed. The music and beautiful scenery complement each other, setting the mood for this breathtaking epic. As you go along through the story, you meet new groups that travel the land and see the different areas of this vast world of Banner saga. Your groups run into interactive scenarios that change your storyline so there is a few careful choices you have to make. This game has a decent tutorial mode as you start, teaching you the units of the game, as well as placement ranges for your attacks, plus learning the perks in battle. Overall, this game has very little flaws and the story is engaging that spans for quite some hours. Definitely worth the 20$ that I have spent.

Overall grade: 9.5 / 10

Pros:
- Breathtaking storyline
- Stunning Visuals
- Engaging Score, sets the mood nicely
- Battles are well done, can set difficulty if it gets too hard

Cons:
- Save states are always automatic, can't manually save and go back

It's no game, more an experince. An Adventure. A Tale. And yes, truly a Saga.

The game brings me back to a kid, reading pictured storybooks, and watching Disney cartoons. You can easily see the inspirations from Sleeping Beauty (1959 film, Disney)

Banner Saga does much with little and show sign of greatness in indie developed games, away from commercialism.

Expect replay value, but only played though once. Felt short, and alot unanswered, but might be corrected in future,

Frenchdog

1 person found this review helpful
Recommended
5.7 hrs on record
A lot of love has obviously gone into the creation of this saga. The lore in the world has been painstakingly crafted. The characters flesh out the further you get into the game. I keep coming back to it despite the little ♥♥♥♥les I have with it. And there are a few:
The price. Too much.
The translations. Sometimes I wonder just what has just happened even after reading through dialogue several times.
The pre combat screen. You can't inspect your characters before going into combat. Who does what and how well?
Lack of transparency. Sometimes the choices you make feel like blind luck. Did that one really alter the story?

Linear? Only the way the baggage train moves. The stort twists and turns. The classes of combatants grows and grows (three types of archers, so far). The combat looks simple. Turn based, square grid. But the more you play the more you develop your tactics and combine characters attacks.
So far it has kept on giving, and I hope will continue to do so.

14.5 hrs on record
This game is phenomenal! The art style is gorgeous with a breathtaking soundtrack to add to the stunning visuals in the scenes. The story is interesting, following more than one character through this epic journey. Your stuck making morale choices for a whole group of people and you care about whether they live or die, even though you haven't met many of them, your characters care enough to make you show the same amount of affection for them. You feel like a leader, striving to survive against a seemly endless enemy and hopless odds. This has and is one of the most enjoyable experiences in gaming I have ever had and I highly recommend it to any and everyone!

0.8 hrs on record
A couple of people have already asked me my initial impressions.. this game really isn't for me. While I love the animation and art style, the tactical gameplay for me has been a bit boring. The RPG system looks pretty light. Sure, you can build a party, but when the culmination of tactical party RPGs is Final Fantasy Tactics, and I *loathe* that game, I feel I'm not the target audience and should have read a bit more about this game before buying it. I've found the story so far somewhat forgettable (would have been a lot more enjoyable for me with full voice.. voice is sorely lacking).. or, honestly, even subtitles for the parts with voice.

This is one of those few games that I can admit is very likely a very good game. It's just not a game for me. It's unfair of me to not recommend it, but I feel people who like this genre of game will enjoy the hell out of it.

jinsaku
721 products in account
0
1 person found this review helpful
Recommended
13.4 hrs on record
A good game, but not amazing. I'm rather baffled at some of the gameplay decisions the designers made for the combat. The tactics are actually pretty flat, largely owing to completely flat battle maps and chess-like mechanics that encourage you to beat down your enemies but not finish them off.

The caravan management system is nice, but much too linear for my tastes - there's a map, but not much point to it since you have little choice in destination or even route you take. Resource management definitely could have used more balancing. There's a single game currency - renown - that acts as both your money and your experience points. This is designed to force you to make hard decisions between having enough supplies to keep your clansmen fed and having heroes powerful enough to beat the challenges they face. In truth, you'll often find yourself short on both starting at around the half-way point of the game and continuing right up until the ending.

I'm not sorry I kickstarted the game, but had I known the end result I probably wouldn't have given quite as much money as I did. Like I said, a good game, but not amazing. The most frustrating thing is that I feel like it could have been amazing with some tweaks - the writing and the art direction are definitely there. I'd give it a 7/10.
